alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 5:27AM MST until August 20 at 8:30AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 830 AM MST. * At 527 AM MST, gauge reports indicated high flows caused by runoff from earlier heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Runoff from earlier rainfall is producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. The Lower Aravaipa Creek streamflow gauge reported a rise to 6.75 feet and is still rising. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Aravaipa Canyon Wilderness. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
